Gets the initial version.

The version does not change until changes are accepted via the method.

member.summary:
Converts an event into another event.

member.summary: Gets the command that will be or is executed.

member.summary: Gets the type of the command.

member.name: P:Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.CommandContext.ExecutorHasBeenCalled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the executor for the command has been called.
member.value:
true if the executor for this command has been called; otherwise, false. true does not have to mean that the executor also executed the command. It could be that an exception had occurred.
This value is always false in the .

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler
member.summary: An event handler that uses a specified action as handler, but only calls this when the event is of a certain type, or is inherited from it.

member.name: F:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler._eventTypeThreshold
member.summary: The event type that should be used as threshold.

member.name: F:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler._exact
member.summary: Specifies whether the event type threshold should be used as an exact or at least threshold.
member.remarks: true means that the event type threshold should be the same type as the event, otherwise the event handler will not be executed. false means that the threshold type should be in the inheritance hierarchy of the event type, or that the threshold type should be an interface that the event type implements, otherwise the handler will not be executed.

member.name: F:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler._handler
member.summary: The handler that should be called when the threshold did not hold the event.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler.#ctor(System.Action{Ncqrs.Domain.DomainEvent},System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The handler that will be called to handle a event when the threshold did not hold the event.
The event type that should be used as threshold.

if set to true the threshold will hold all types that are not the same type; otherwise it hold all types that are not inhered from the event type threshold or implement the interface that is specified by the threshold type.

requires.description: The eventTypeThreshold should be of a type that implements the IEvent interface.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler.HandleEvent(Ncqrs.Domain.DomainEvent)
member.summary: Handles the event.
member.param:
The event to handle.
This value should not be null.
member.returns: true when the event was handled; otherwise, false. false does not mean that the handling failed, but that the handler was not interested in handling this event.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler.ObjectInvariants
member.summary: This method holds all the objects invariants.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Domain.TypeThresholdedActionBasedDomainEventHandler.ShouldHandleThisEvent(Ncqrs.Domain.DomainEvent)
member.summary: Determine whether the event should be handled or not.
member.returns: true when this event should be handled; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Ncqrs.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace contains the components of the Ncqrs framework. The framework is devided in tree main sections.
Commanding is the section where everything related to commands, command execution and command services can be found.
Domain is the section where everything related to the domain can be found. In this section you find things like and the .
Eventing is the section where everything related to events, denormalization and event services can be found.
For more information about the framework, visit ncqrs.org or visit the blog.

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Domain.Mapping.ConventionBasedDomainEventHandlerMappingStrategy
member.summary:
A internal event handler mapping strategy that maps methods as an event handler based on method name and parameter type.
All method that match the following requirements are mapped as an event handler:
Method name should start with On or on. Like: OnProductAdded or onProductAdded.
The method should only accept one parameter.
The parameter must be, or inhired from, the class.

member.name: P:Ncqrs.Domain.AggregateRoot.InitialVersion
member.summary:
Gets the initial version.
This represents the current version of this instance. When this instance was retrieved via history, it contains the version as it was at that time. For new instances this value is always 0.
The version does not change until changes are accepted via the method.
member.value: The initial version.

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.ICommandServiceInterceptor
member.summary: Allows users to intercept commands before or after they has been executed in a command service. This allows them to add additional behavior before or after the execution of commands. The method will be called before every command execution and will be called after every command execution.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.ICommandServiceInterceptor.OnBeforeBeforeExecutorResolving(Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.CommandContext)
member.summary:
Intercepts a command execution before the command executor is resolved.
In this method the interceptor may override the command by setting the property.
member.param: The context of the current command execution.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.ICommandServiceInterceptor.OnBeforeExecution(Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.CommandContext)
member.summary: Intercepts a command execution before the command will be executed, but after the executor has been resolved.
member.param: The context of the current command execution.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.ICommandServiceInterceptor.OnAfterExecution(Ncqrs.Commanding.ServiceModel.CommandContext)
member.summary: Intercepts a command execution when a exception has been occurred or after the command has been executed. See the to determine whether the command has been executed.
member.param: The context of the current command execution.

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Eventing.Conversion.EventConverter
member.summary: A dispatcher that dispatch event conversion to the converters that have been added based on event type. When an event should be converted it resolved the corresponding converter and uses that one to convert the event. When there is also a converter that can convert the result of that conversion that one is called.

The type of the result of the conversion.
member.param: The converter method that does the conversion.
member.returns: The current that can be used to chain method calls.

The converter method that does the conversion.
member.returns: The current that can be used to chain method calls.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Eventing.Conversion.EventConverter.Convert(Ncqrs.Eventing.ISourcedEvent)
member.summary: Converts an event. It uses all converters available to convert the given event. That means that when an event of Evnt_V1 is given and there are converters that can convert Evnt_V1 intro Evnt_V2 and Evnt_V2 in Evnt_V3, the result of this method is a conversion from Evnt_V1 to Evnt_V3.
member.returns: A new event based on the .

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Eventing.ISnapshotable`1
member.summary: This interface flags an object beeing snapshotable. This means that the state of the object could be saved to an object and restored from a the from the same class. This is used to prevent building 's from the ground up.
member.remarks: Only one can be implemented. If you implement more than one, it will cause an exception when saving this instance.

member.name: T:Ncqrs.Commanding.CommandExecution.Mapping.CommandMappingConfiguration
member.summary: Helper methods to get properties and parameter values from commands.

member.summary: Gets all the values for the parameters filled with the values from the command.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Commanding.CommandExecution.Mapping.CommandMappingConfiguration.GetPropertyValueBasedOnParameterInfo(Ncqrs.Commanding.ICommand,System.Reflection.ParameterInfo)
member.summary: Gets the property value from the first matched property. The match is made by the name and the type of the specified parameter.
member.remarks: The property match is done by the name and type, where the name is matched case insensitive and the type of the parameter type should be assignable from the property type.
member.exception: Thrown when command or parameterInfo is null.
member.returns: The value from the first matched property.

member.name: M:Ncqrs.Commanding.CommandExecution.Mapping.CommandMappingConfiguration.GetCommandProperties(Ncqrs.Commanding.ICommand)
member.summary: Gets all the properties from the command that should be used in the auto mapping process.
member.remarks: All properties marked with the are ignored.
member.returns: A result set containing all properties that should be used in the auto mapping process.
